meanings.definition: A type of mystery novel or play in which the identity of the perpetrator of a crime is revealed at the end.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy reading whodunnits because I like guessing who did the crime.
meanings.sent2: She borrowed a stack of whodunnits from the library for her weekend reading.
meanings.sent3: The detective in the whodunnit was so clever that he solved the case in just one chapter!
meanings.sent4: The whodunnit unfolded like a carefully crafted puzzle, each clue leading to the final revelation.
meanings.sent5: The whodunnit kept me on the edge of my seat, trying to unravel the mystery along with the characters.

meanings.definition: The act of solving a crime or mystery to determine who committed it.
meanings.sent1: Detectives use their skills to solve whodunnits and bring criminals to justice.
meanings.sent2: The whodunnit was so intriguing that she couldn't stop thinking about who the culprit might be.
meanings.sent3: In the game of Clue, players engage in a fun whodunnit scenario to figure out the murderer.
meanings.sent4: Her investigation into the missing cookies turned into a delicious whodunnit with her siblings.
meanings.sent5: The whodunnit challenge at the escape room had participants racing against the clock to uncover the truth.
